page.title: 06DOYNTON VILLAGE,COLD ASHTON
page.content: In 1086, Didintone was the farmstead or TUN of one Dydda. Through the centuries to 1986 it has become {Doynton,}the homestead of about 350 people. Some work in the village but others have to journey to neighbouring cities and towns. Yet there is evidence of{community spirit}- the attractive appearance of one of the {best kept villages}in Avon and a plaque to prove it; the playing field with swings for the children and a cricket pitch. See the{village hall designed, built and given by C.S.Clarke Esq., in 1937. It is used regularly by associations with a wide appeal - Womens Institute, Young Farmers, Keep Fit, Goat Club. It can be hired for public and private functions. It is also used as a polling station in elections and for Parish Council meetings.
